description: TO AMEND S. RES. 7, PROVIDING THAT SEN. MOSES OF NEW HAMP- SHIRE BE ELECTED PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE PRO-TEMPORE, BY SUBSTITUTING THE NAME OF SENATOR PITTMAN OF NEVADA FOR THAT OF SENATOR MOSES.  (P. 11-1)

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR HOLDING THAT A MOTION TO CONSIDER IN OPEN SESSION THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES B. WARREN TO BE ATTORNEY GENERAL INVOLVES A SUSPENSION OF THE RULES AND REQUIRED A 2/3 MAJORITY TO SUSTAIN IT.
TO CONSIDER IN OPEN SESSION THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES B. WARREN TO BE ATTORNEY GENERAL.

TO PROVIDE THAT SO MUCH OF THE RULE AS PROVIDES FOR THE ELECTION OF COMMITTEES OF THE SENATE BY BALLOT BE SUSPENDED AND THAT THOSE WHOSE NAMES ARE SUBMITTED SHALL CONSTITUTE THE VARIOUS STANDING COMMITTEES.  (JP. 302-2 303-1)
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES B. WARREN TO BE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE, CONSENTING TO THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES B. WARREN TO BE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO CONSIDER S. RES. 5, PROVIDING FOR ADHESION ON THE PART OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE PROTOCOL OF DECEMBER 16, 1920, AND THE ADJOINED STATUTE FOR THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE, WITH RESERVATION.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND CUBA SIGNED MARCH 2, 1904, FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF TITLE TO THE OWNERSHIP OF THE ISLE OF PINES, BY PROVIDING THAT CUBA SHALL MAKE NO LAW APPLICABLE TO THE ISLE OF PINES ABRIDGING THE RIGHTS GUARANTEED IN THE FIRST TEN AMENDMENTS TO THE U.S. CONSTITUTION.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION OF A TREATY BE- TWEEN THE U.S. AND CUBA FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF TITLE TO THE ISLE OF PINES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO DECIDE WHETHER THE SENATOR FROM KENTUCKY (SEN. ERNST) BE ALLOWED TO PROCEED IN ORDER, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF REPORT OF COUZENS COMMITTEE, RELATING TO THEIR INVESTIGATION OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE BUREAU.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF CHARLES B. WARREN AS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR HOLDING THAT A MOTION TO CONSIDER IN OPEN SESSION THE NOMINATION OF W. MC CAMANT TO BE U.S. JUDGE INVOLVED SUSPENSION AND REQUIRED A 2/3 MA- JORITY TO SUSTAIN IT.
TO CONSIDER THE NOMINATION OF WALLACE MCCAMANT TO BE THE NINTH CIRCUIT.
TO PASS S. RES. 91, PROVIDING TO INVESTIGATE WHETHER MONEY HAS BEEN EXPANDED BY FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS TO INFLUENCE FOR- EIGN POLICY OF THE U.S..  (P. 1558-1,2)

TO AMEND S. RES. 104, DECLARING GERALD P. NYE NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THE UNITED STATES SENATE FROM NORTH DAKOTA, PROVIDING THAT GERALD P. NYE SHOULD BE SEATED AS A SENATOR FROM NORTH DAKOTA.  (P. 1892-2)

TO RECESS, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 5, PROVIDING FOR ADHESION ON THE PART OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE PROTOCOL OF DECEMBER 16, 1920, AND ADJOINED STATUTE FOR THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE, WITH RESERVATION. (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO ADJOURN, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 5.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO TABLE APPEAL FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR RULING THAT "NO DILATORY MOTION, OR DILATORY AMENDMENT, OR AMENDMENTS NOT GERMANE, SHALL BE IN ORDER," MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 5.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION NO. 1 TO S. RES. 5, WHICH PROVIDES THAT SUCH ADHERENCE SHALL NOT BE TAKEN TO INVOLVE ANY LEGAL RELATION ON THE PART OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE LEAGUE OF NATIONS OR THE ASSUMPTION OF ANY OBLIGATIONS BY THE UNITED STATES UNDER THE TREATY OF VERSAITLES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION NO. 2 TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE PERMITTED TO PARTICIPATE THROUGH REPRESENTATIONS DESIGNATED FOR THE PURPOSE AND UPON AN EQUALITY WITH THE OTHER MEMBER STATES, RESPECTIVELY, OF THE COUNCIL AND ASSEMBLY OF THE LEAGUE OF NATIONS IN ANY AND ALL PROCEEDINGS OF EITHER THE COUNCIL OR THE ASSENBLY FOR THE ELECTION OF JUDGES OR DEPUTY JUDGES OF THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE OR FOR THE FILLING OF VACANCIES. (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION NO. 3 TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE UNITED STATES WILL PAY A FAIR SHARE OF THE EXPENSES OF THE COURT AS DETERMINED AND APPROPRIATED FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION NO. 4 TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE UNITED STATES MAY AT ANYTIME WITHDRAW ITS ADHERENCE TO THE SAID PROTOCOL AND THAT THE STATURE FOR THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTER, JUSTICE ADJOURNED TO THE PROTOCOL SHALL NOT BE AMENDED WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF THE U.S.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST PARAGRAPH OF RESERVATION NO. 5, TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE COURT SHALL NOT RENDER ANY ADVISORY OPINION EXCEPT AFTER DUE NOTICE TO ALL STATES ADHERING TO THE COURT AND TO ALL INTERESTED STATES AND AFTER PUBLIC HEARING OR OPPORTUNITY FOR HEARING GIVEN TO ANY STATES CONCERNED NOR SHALL IT, WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF THE UNITED STATES, ENTERTAIN ANY REQUEST FOR AN ADVISORY OPINION TOUCHING ANY DISPUTE OR QUESTION IN WHICH THE UNITED STATES HAS OR CLAIMS AN INTEREST.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AMEND S. RES. 5, BY PROVIDING THAT THE MONROE DOCTRINE BE DECLARED AS A PRINCIPLE OF INTERNATIONAL LAW BINDING UPON THE COURT.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AGREE TO A RESERVATION TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING A CONDI- TION FOR ADHERENCE OF U.S. TO THE STATURES OF THE WORLD COURT.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT ADHERENCE OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE STATURES OF THE WORLD COURT IS CONDITIONAL UPON THE UNDERSTANDING THAT IN THE ELECTION OF THE JUDGES IN EACH ELECTORAL BODY, EACH SIGNATORY STATE SHALL HAVE ONE VOTE, BUT NOT MORE THAN ONE VOTE SHALL BE CAST IN EITHER THE ASSEMBLY OR THE COUNCIL BY THE BRITISH EMPIRE AND THE STATES INCLUDED THEREIN.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT NO QUESTION SHALL BE SUBMITTED TO THE COURT WHICH INVOLVES IN ANY MANNER ANY LOAN MADE BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES OR BY AMERICAN CITIZENS OR CORPORATIONS TO ANY FOREIGN GOVERNMENT, WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF THE UNITED STATES THROUGH A JOINT RESOLUTION OF CONGRESS.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)

TO AGREE TO RESERVATION TO S. RES. 5, PROVIDING THAT THE SIGNATURE OF THE UNITED STATES TO THE PROTOCOL OF SIGNATURE OF THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE SHALL NOT BECOME EFFECTIVE UNTIL ARTICLE 1 AND PARAGRAPH 1 OF ARTICLE 36 OF THE STATURE OF THE PERMANENT COURT OF IN- TERNATIONAL JUSTICE SHALL HAVE BEEN SO AMENDED AS TO PROVIDE THAT THE PERMANENT COURT OF INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE SHALL DISCHARGE NO DUTY OR FUNCTION OTHER THAN THAT OF RENDERING JUDICIAL DECISIONS IN CASES BROUGHT TO IT BY DIRECT COMMOM CONSENT OF THE PARTIES THERETO.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AMEND S. RES. 5 BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE WORD "RESOLUTION" AND INSERTING CERTAIN WORDS.  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AMEND S. RES. 5 BY STRIKING OUT THE WORDS "AND CONSENT TO".  (THIS VOTE WAS TAKEN IN OPEN EXECUTIVE SESSION.)
TO AGREE TO S. RES. 5 AS MODIFIED.

TO AMEND H.R. 1, (44 STAT-9 FEB. 26, 1926), A BILL REDUCING AND EQUALIZING TAXATION AND PROVIDING REVENUE, BY STRIKING OUT ON P. 82, LINE 13, THE WORDS 12 1/2 PER CENTUM, AND IN- SERTING IN LIEU THEREOF, 13 1/2 PER CENTUM.  (P. 3139-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY LEVYING EXCISE TAXES ON CORPORATIONS WITHIN CERTAIN LIMITS DEPENDING AN THE AVERAGE AMOUNT OF CAPITAL EMPLOYED IN THE TRANSACTION OF BUSINESS, OR (IN CASE OF FOREIGN CORPORATIONS) DEPENDING ON THE AVERAGE AMOUNT OF CAPITAL STOCK EMPLOYED IN THE TRANSACTION OF BUSINESS IN THE U.S.  (P. 3152-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY LOWERING THE TAXES ON INCOMES, BY REDUCING THE SURTAX WITHIN BRACKETS BETWEEN $60,000 TO $500,000.  (P. 3218-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY REGULATING THE TAX ON INCOMES OVER $100,000 BY ADDING 1% FOR EVERY ADDITIONAL $50,000 UP TO $1,000,000, INSTEAD OF A FLAT RATE FIXED BY THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE BILL ON ALL INCOMES OF $100,000 OR MORE. (P. 3219-1,2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY ADDING FIVE NEW BRACKETS OF SURTAXES FROM $100,000 TO $500,000 AND INCREASING THE RATE OF THE TAX FROM A FLAT 20% FIXED BY THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE TO A RATE WHICH INCREASES 1% UP TO 25%.  (P. 3221-1)
TO RECESS UNTIL 11 AM TOMORROW.  (P. 3297-2)

TO PROCEED TO CONSIDERATION OF S. RES. 43, REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO TAKE STEPS FOR THE IMMEDIATE RESUMPTION OF THE PRODUCTIONS OF ANTHRACITE COAL MINING, MADE DURING CONSI- DERATION OF H.R. 1.  (P. 3343-2)
TO TABLE S. RES. 134, REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO INVITE TO THE WHITE HOUSE THE ANTHRACITE COAL OPERATORS AND MINERS COMMITTEE FOR A SETTLEMENT OF THE ANTHRACITE OF THE COAL STRIKE.  (P. 3428-1)
TO CONSIDER S. RES. 134, REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO INVITE TO THE WHITE HOUSE THE COMMITTEE OF OPERATORS AND MINERS WITH A VIEW TO THE SETTLEMENT OF THE ANTHRACITE COAL STRIKE.  (P. 3428-1)
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE AGREEING TO THE AMENDMENT OF THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE, TO H.R. 1.  (P.3432-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROTECTING THE INTEREST OF SMALL TOBACCO GROWERS AND COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATIONS.  (P. 3437-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROVIDING THAT INCOME TAX RETURNS BE OPEN TO EXAMINATION OR INSPECTION AS OTHER PUBLIC RECORDS UNDER THE SAME RULES AND REGULATIONS AS MAY GOVERN THE EXAMINATION OF PUBLIC DOCUMENTS GENERALLY.  (P. 3525-2)

TO PASS S. RES. 134, REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO INVITE TO THE WHITE HOUSE, THE COMMITTEE OF OPERATORS AND MINERS IN ORDER THAT HE MIGHT URGE UPON THEM THE IMPORTANCE OF AN IMMEDIATE SETTLEMENT OF THE ANTHRACITE COAL STRIKE. (P. 3588-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISIONS RELATING TO EXISTING ESTATE AND INHERITANCE TAXES.  (P. 3695-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY ELIMINATING THE TAX ON ADMISSION TO THEATERS.  (P. 3696-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY IMPOSING A TAX OF 2% ON AUTOMOBILES, TRUCK AND WAGON CHASSIS, SOLD OR LEASED, FOR AN AMOUNT IN EXCESS OF $200, AND TO PROVIDE THAT A SALE OF EITHER AUTOMOBILE OR WAGON SHALL BE CONSIDERED A SALE OF CHASSIS AND BODY.  (P. 3699-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY STRIKING OUT A PROVISION SETTING A 3% TAX ON AUTOMOBILES AND AUTO PARTS.  (P. 3702-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROVIDING FOR A DEPLETION ALLOWANCE OF 35% IN CASE OF OIL AND GAS WELLS.  (P. 3775-2 3776-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY ALLOWING 30% FROM GROSS INCOME IN CASE OF OIL AND GAS WELLS, FOR DEPLETION OF PROPERTY. (P. 3777-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY ALLOWING FOR DEPLETION OF PROPERTY IN CASE OF OIL AND GAS WELLS, AND THAT ALLOWANCE SHALL NOT EXCEED 50% OF THE NEXT INCOME OF THE TAXPAYERS COMPUTED WITHOUT ALLOWANCE FOR DEPLETION FROM THE PROPERTY, EXCEPT THAT IN NO CASE SHALL THE DEPLETION ALLOWANCE BE LESS THAN IT WOULD BE IF WITHOUT REFERENCE TO THE PARAGRAPH VOTED ON. (P. 3777-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROVIDING THAT WHERE RETURNS ARE MADE ACCORDING TO THE REGULATIONS OF THE TREASURY DEPT., AND WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF A PROPERLY QUALIFIED OFFICIAL, A RECEIPT SHALL BE ISSURED TO THE TAXPAYER BY THE DEPT. WHEN THE AMOUNT FOUND DUE IS PAID AND THIS RECEIPT SHALL BE FINAL (EXCEPT IN CASES OF ACTUAL FRAUD.) (P. 3783-2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY MAKING THE TERMS OF MEMBERS OF THE TAX APPEALS BOARD 6 YEARS INSTEAD OF 10 YEARS, AND ALL SUCCESSORS TO HAVE THE SAME TENURE OF OFFICE.  (P. 3791)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROVIDING THAT ANY GIFT, BEQUEST, OR INHERITANCE IN EXCESS OF $5,000, SHALL BE CONSIDERED AND ACCOUNTED FOR AS GROSS INCOME, AND ALL BEQUESTS FROM HUSBAND TO WIFE, OR FATHER TO SON OR DAUGHTER OVER $50,000 SHALL BE CONSIDERED GROSS INCOME.  (P. 3850-2) NOTE: RECORD SHOWS EXCESS VALUE OVER $25,000 AND BEQUESTS OVER $2000,000 BY HUSBAND TO WIFE OR FATHER TO SON OR DAUGHTER CONSIDERED GROSS INCOME.
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY SUBSTITUTING THE FIGURE $50,000 FOR $20,000 AS THE "EARNED NET INCOME" FOR WAGES, SALARIES, PROFESSIONAL FEES, AND OTHER AMOUNTS RECEIVED AS COMPENSATION.  (P. 3857-1,2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, SO AS TO RAISE $43,000,000 (AS AGAINST $100,000,000 IN THE HOUSE PROVISION) ON ESTATE TAXES, BY ESTABLISHING A GRADED % RATE FOR ESTATES OF $50,000 AND ABOVE.  (P. 3861-62)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, SO AS TO ELIMINATE WHAT SENATOR HARRISON TERMS "A NUISANCE TAX" BY STRIKING OUT THE STAMP TAX ON CAPITAL-STOCK ISSUES ON WHICH THE GOVERNMENT GETS ONLY ABOUT $10,000,000 A YEAR.  (P. 3868-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY PROTECTING A MAN'S HOMESTEAD OR PERSONAL PROPERTY, FROM BEING CONFISCATED FOR A DEBT TO THE GOVERNMENT FOR INTERNAL REVENUE TAXES, IN THE SAME AMOUNT THAT HIS STATE LAW EXEMPTS HIS HOME FROM BEING CONFISCATED FOR DEBT.  (P. 3871-1,2)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, BY LOWERING THE PURPOSED $10,000 SALARY FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TAX APPEALS TO $7500, THE AMOUNT NOW RECEIVED.  (P. 3881-1,2)
TO CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1, MADE IN COMM. OF THE WHOLE, WHICH AMENDMENT REPEALS THE INGERITANCE TAX. (P. 3885-2)

TO CONCUR IN AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 1, MADE IN COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT TITLE V. ON PAGE 224 RELATIVE TO THE TAX ON ADMISSIONS AND DUES, SUCH AS THEATRES, OPERAS AND AMUSEMENT.  (P. 3886-1)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, SO AS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL REVENUE OF $10,000,000, BY CHANGING THE GRADUATED RATES ON INCOMES FROM $100,000 TO $1,000,000 AND ABOVE.  NP. 3887-1,2)
TO PASS S.R. 1.  (P.3896-1)
TO PASS S. RES. 9, PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE U.S. CONSTITUTION, CHANGING THE DATE OF INAUGURATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND THE ASSEMBLY OF THE CONGRESS.

TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5959, TREASURY AND POST OFFICE APROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1927, WAS OUT OF ORDER BECAUSE IT PROPOSED GENERAL LEGISLATION IN AN APPROPRIATIONS BILL. (P. 3988-1)
TO SUSTAIN THE RULING OF THE CHAIR ON H.R. 1, WHICH RULING PRECLUDED A MOTION TO RECOMMIT H.R. 1 TO CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS.  (P. 4479-2)
TO CONCUR IN THE CONFERENCE REPORT TO H.R. 1. (P. 4497-1

TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT TO H.R. 8722 (P. 36, MAR. 3, 1926), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPLY URGENT DEFICIENCIES IN CERTAIN APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1926, AND PRIOR FISCAL YEARS, TO PROVIDE URGENT SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1926 AND 1927 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.    (O QUORUM.

TO AGREE TO THE REPORT NO. 177, TO S. RES. 109, DIRECTING AN INVESTIGATION CONCERNING THE DILIGENCE WITH WHICH THE DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE HAS INVESTIGATED THE CHARGE OF VIOLATION BY THE ALUMINUM CO. OF AMERICA OF A DECREE OF THE UNITED STATES DESTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF PENNSYLVANIA.  (P. 3962-1 4622-1)

TO TABLE THE APPEAL FROM THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR, MADE DURING THE CONSIDERATION OF H. CON. RES. 4, PROVIDING FOR A COMMITTEE TO CONDUCT NEGOTIATIONS FOR LEASING MUSCLE SHOALS WHICH DECISION HELD THAT THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION UNDERTOOK TO AMEND A PERMANENT STATITE OF THE U.S. AND THIS WAS NOT POSSIBLE TO BE DONE BY CONCURRENT RESOLUTION. (P. 4768-1)
TO AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE REPORT, ON H.R. 8722, (P. 36-MAR. 3, 1926), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS TO SUPPLY URGENT DEFICENCIES FOR FISCAL 1926 AND 1927 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.  (P. 4829-2)
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 4, BY AUTHORIZING AND DIRECTING THE COMMITTEE TO CONDUCT NEGOTIATIONS FOR "LEASES" AS WELL AS "A LEASE" AS PROVIDED IN CONCURRENT RESOLUTION.  (P. 5215-2)
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 4, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE SHALL REPORT TO CONGRESS NOT LATER THAN APRIL 26, 1926.
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 4, BY ADDING TO RESOLUTION "SUCH POWER TO BE EQUITABLY DISTRIBUTED AMONG THE COMMUNITIES AND STATES TO WHICH IT MAY BE PROPERLY TRANSPORTED." P. 5216-I)
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 4, BY PROVIDING THAT LEASE SHALL BE FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED 30 YEARS. (P. 5217-2)
TO AMEND H. CON. RES. 4, BY PROVIDING THAT LEASE SHALL BE FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED 30 YEARS.  (P. 5217-2)

TO PASS THE SUBSTITUTE RESOLUTION TO H. CON. RES. 4, WHICH SUBSTITUTE PROVIDES THAT SEC. OF AGRICULTURE SHALL CARRY OUT PROVISIONS OF THE ACT, THAT HE SHALL FORM A CORPORATION WITH CAPITAL NOT EXCEEDING $5,000,000 TO CONDUCT BUSINESS AND APPROPRIATES, $58000,000 FOR THE PURPOSE. P. 5218-1,2)

TO PASS H. CON. RES. 4, AS MODIFIED, WHICH PROVIDES FOR A JOINT COMMITTEE OF SIX, THREE FROM SENATE AND THREE FROM HOUSE TO CONDUCT NEGOTIATIONS FOR LEASING MUSCLE SHOALS: THAT SAID LEASE SHALL BE FOR NOT MORE THAN 50 YEARS, THAT COMMITTEE SHALL REPORT NOT LATER THAN APRIL 26, 1926. (P. 5219-2)
CONFIRMATION OF CHARLES. W. HUNT TO BE A MEMBER OF THE FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION.

TO AMEND S. RES. 162, PROVIDING FOR INVESTIGATING ADMINISTRATION OF THE TARIFF ACT OF 1922 WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO THE REGULATIONS AND PROCEDURE OF THE TARIFF COMMISSION, BY PROVIDING THAT THE COMMITTEE SHALL ALSO INVESTIGATE APPORNTMENTS OF MEMBERS OF THE COMMISSION AS TO ANY ATTEMPT TO INFLUENCE THE ACTION OF THE COMMISSION AND IF SO, WHAT MEANS WERE USED, AND REPORT BACK TO THE SENATE. (P. 5387-1)

TO AMEND S. RES. 162, INVESTIGATING THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE TARIFF ACT OF 1922, WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO THE REGULATIONS AND PROCEDURE OF THE TARIFF COMMISSION, SO AS TO PROVIDE FOR APPOINTMENT OF A SPECIAL COMMITTEE COMPOSED OF FIVE SENATORS, THREE OF OF WHOM SHALL BE MEMBERS OF THE MAJORITY, AND TWO FROM THE MINORITY. (P. 5388-1)

TO ADJOURN, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 9341, (P. 141-APRIL 22, 1926), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE, AND SUNDRY INDEPENDENT EXCUTIVE BUREAUS, BOARDS, COMMISSIONS, AND OFFICERS FOR FISCAL 1927, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PASS S. 575, A BILL AMENDING SEC. 4 OF THE INTERSTATE COMMERCE ACT.  (P. 5450-1 P. 6145-2)

WHEELER OF MONTANA, WHICH FIRST PART DIRECTS THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO SUBMIT TO SENATE STATEMENT OF MONEY EXPENDED OR OBLIGATIONS INCURRED IN THE PROSECUTION OF SENATOR BURTON K. WHEELER. TO GO INTO EXECUTIVE SESSION, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H. R. 9795, (P156 APRIL 29, 1926), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPTS. OF STATE AND JUSTICE AND JUDICIARY AND DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND LABOR FOR FISCAL 1927 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.  (P. 6441-1)

TO AMEND S. 4808, BY PROVIDING THAT IN ANY STATE WHERE 50% OF THE PRODUCERS OF COOPERATIVE OR OTHER ORGANIZATION VOTE FOR THE COMMENCEMENT OR TERMINATION OF ANY OPERATIONS IN ANY BASIC AGRICULTURAL COMMODITY, SUCH ACTION MAY BE TAKEN, BUT NOT UNTIL THE BOARD SHALL BECOME SATISFIED THAT A MAJORITY OF THE PRODUCERS OF SUCH COMMODITY FAVOR SUCH ACTION.  (P. 3515-2)

TO AMEND S. 4808, BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE OF THE BILL AND INSERTING OTHER TEXT IN LIEU THEREOF. FOR DETAILS SEE PP. 166-169 OF JOURAL, AND PP. 3125-3127 OF THE CONGRESSIONAL RECORD.
TO PASS S. 4808.

TO RECEDE FROM CERTAIN SENATE AMENDMENTS, AND THAT THE SENATE CONCUR IN AMENDMENTS MADE BY THE HOUSE TO CERTAIN SENATE AMMENDMENTS TO H. R. 2, (44 STAT-1224, FEB. 25, 1927) A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS AND FEDERAL RESERVE ACT.  (P. 3572-2)

TO AMEND H. R. 13446 , A BILL REGULATING THE RATES OF POSTAGE, BY STRIKING OUT THE COMMITTEE AMENDMENT INCREASING THE RATES ON 3RD CLASS MATTER AND IN LIEU THEREOF MAKING THE RATE 1 CENT FOR EACH 2 OUNCES OR FRACTION THEREOF UP TO 8 OUNCES IN WEIGHT.  (P. 3668-1)

TO CLOSE DEBATE, RECEDE FROM CERTAIN AMENDMENTS AND AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 2, (P. 639, FEB. 25, 1927), A BILL AMENDING THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS AND FEDERAL RESERVE ACT, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO ADJOURN.

TO RECEDE FROM AMENDMENTS AND AGREE TO AMENDMENTS OF HOUSE TO H.R. 2 (44 STAT-1224, FEB. 25, 1927), A BILL TO FURTHER AMEND THE NATIONAL BANKING LAWS AND THE FEDERAL RESERVE ACT BY RECEDING FROM AMENDMENTS #1, 13, 14, 15, 16 AND 35 AND THAT THE SENATE AGREE TO THE AMENDMENTS OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES TO THE AMENDMENTS OF THE #11, 26, 30, 36, 37, 38 AND 39 AND TO THE AMENDMENT TO THE TITLE OF THE BILL. (P. 3957-2)

TO AMEND H. R. 16886, (44 STAT-1389, MAR. 3, 1927), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE DIRECTOR OF THE U. S. VETERAN'S BUREAU TO MAKE LOANS TO VETERANS UPON THE SECURITY OF ADJUSTED SERVICE CERTIFICATES, BY PROVIDING THAT AT THE END OF THE BILL A NEW SECTION SHALL BE INSERTED AS FOLLOWS:-THAT PARAGRAPH (7) OF SECTION 202 OF THE WORLD WAR VETERAN'S ACT, 1924, AS AMENDED IS HEREBY REPEALED.  (P. 4330-1)

TO AMEND H. R. 16886, BY PROVIDING THAT BOYS AND GIRLS SHOULD BE GIVEN AS GOOD EDUCATION AND AS THOROUGH A BUSINESS PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AS THEY WOULD HAVE RECEIVED HAD THE WAR NOT DEPRIVED THEM OF THE SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE OF THEIR FATHERS, AND THAT PAYMENT BE EXTENDED FOR THIS PURPOSE FROM AFTER THE AGE 18 OF YEARS TO 21 YEARS. (P. 4333-2)
TO RECESS.  (P. 4454-1)
TO RECESS.  (P. 4510-2)
TO CONSIDER H. R. 16886.  (P. 4532-1)

TO AMEND S. 718, A BILL ENABLING ANY STATE TO COOPERATE WITH ANY OTHER STATE OR STATES OR WITH THE U.S. FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE WATERSHEDS OF NAVIGABLE STREAMS, AND TO APPOINT A COMMISSION FOR THE ACQUISITION OF LANDS FOR CONSERVING NAVIGABLE RIVERS, BY PROVIDING THAT NO LANDS SHALL BE PURCHASED EXCEPT THOSE LANDS WHICH ARE NECESSARY FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE HEADWATERS OF NAVIGABLE STREAMS.
